headline: Oven Fried Chicken
description: This easy oven-fried chicken recipe is less messy than frying; the chicken gets crispy on top but stays tender and juicy inside.

video.description: See a delicious, healthier way to make fried chicken.
video.name: Oven-Fried Chicken II

name: Oven Fried Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place flour in a shallow plate or bowl and season with salt and pepper to taste. Put bread crumbs in another shallow plate or bowl and beat eggs in another bowl.
Dredge chicken piece by piece in the flour, then the egg, then the bread crumbs, until all pieces are coated.
Pour oil into a large baking dish; add the breaded chicken thighs and sprinkle with paprika to taste.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, then turn pieces over and bake for another 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and drain on paper towels.

review.reviewBody: This was one of the best chicken dishes we‚Äôve EVER eaten!! I substituted a couple of tablespoons of butter instead of oil, and melted it in oven while preheating dishes. I also added plenty of garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper to the flour, and salt and peppered chicken before coating. I turned up oven temp to 375 for second half, and turned every 10 minutes for first half. I‚Äôm not sure that was necessary and think this base recipe is great for personal adaptation. Some of our pieces were skinless breasts, just as good!! All was exceptional, moist and flavorful. Thank you!
Perfect recipe! The chicken is nicely crisp on the outside and juicy on the inside. Spice it up which way you like and with so little oil, it‚Äôs a keeper
So easy without the oil. This would be great for a fish coating!
This was an excellent recipe. Fam loved it. I would recommend to a friend.

I could have managed with two eggs .we used drumsticks and panko breadcrumbs that I seasoned. It took longer to cook but I did preheat the oven to 400 and cooked five minutes then turned down to recommend temp. It took longer than an hour. But my gosh what an excellent recipe! Crispy and tender. I‚Äôm making this again for sure.
Best meal I ever cooked
Kim West omits oil and cooks at 400 degrees. If using skinless chicken, spray with Pam after coated.

Excellent recipe - delicious, moist chicken that was just as good cold as it was out of the oven. I used Italian seasoned Panko crumbs. I eliminated the oil by spraying parchment paper with a non-stick spray, so it was even healthier! This is a keeper for sure.

I love how moist and tender this chicken is! The breading came off a bit as I took them out of the dish, but that could be because I used self-rising flour. I didn't have all purpose. Still, this is a winner. I will probably never panfry chicken again.

It was VERY easy to make. My family is Gluten Intolerant, so I used Schar GF bread crumbs. My grandmother had no vegetable oil, so I used corn oil. We didn't have 12 chicken drumsticks, only 6, so I just cut everything's amount in half. I added garlic powder and extra paprika, plus other spices since Schar's bread crumbs had no seasoning. It was great because we had extra eggs and this uses 3 eggs! The time is a little long and the 350 ¬∞F is low. How do you convert the temperature into the time?
Great recipe made it alot now
Only thing I did not like was oven temp and cooking time. I increased temp because it was taking longer then it should have to brown, which leads to dryer chicken!
It was easy to make. The taste I enhanced with my own seasonings. I will make it again. It was quick and easy.
This is the ‚Äúonly‚Äù crispy baked chicken that actually came out CRISPY- delicious!!!
The chicken came out great üòäüòã added a few of different seasonings other than that I followed directions
I originally made it to take on a pinic. It was great cold. Having also made it and eaten it right from the oven was also a outstanding

I love the concept of frying chicken in the oven. I followed the recipe exactly as written. I used the 1/2 cup of oil but I needed 2 9 x 13 inch pans for all the chicken and I split the 1/2 cup oil for both each pan had 1/4 cup of oil. The chicken came out crispy. It was good but me and family thought it could of used more seasoning which I‚Äôll do the next time I make it. I also floured the chicken and put in fridge for an hour before the egg and bread crumbs. Doing this kept the breading on better.
Pretty good, but I fried in frying pan last 10 min to crisp up more.

I just made this tonight. It was great. It reminds me of how my mother used to make it. The only thing I changed was I mashed up corn flakes in place of the bread crumbs or whatever it was called. Corn Flakes were how we made it as a kid. I'm just glad I found the recipe online so I could make it for the family.

This was so good! I did add onion and garlic powder to the flour and Parmesan to the bread crumbs. Next time I think I‚Äôll split the thoughts up into two pans. It definitely took longer because my pan was crowded.
Decent
love this recipe! I make it often!

This recipe is by far the best oven fried chicken I have ever made. I added the packet of ranch that some nice person suggested and wow. AMAZING for comming out of the oven. I also just used olive oil spray. it was crunchy!
I am in the middle of cooking so i dont know how it is going to turn out yet but I like how simple the preparation was. Can't wait to try it!

This is a great base recipe. I added all my spices (curry, paprika, salt, pepper, touch of chilli pepper and parmesan) to the bread crumbs. I wanted my crispy shell to have the flavor as I bit into it. I didn't find the chicken greasy like most people said. I also used drumsticks. Definitely making again!
Used butter after reading the reviews , also started them skin side down . Definitely season the chicken too . Very good , crunchy .
VERY TASTY
No substations, delicious and easy
I used melted butter instead of oil in the baking pan. The chicken turned out to be very moist and delicious. This recipe is a Keeper!

I'd found this recipe & made it for our Christmas dinner. I was so disappointed. It was way too oily, didn't have nearly enough spice and way overcooked based on the recommended time. The chicken was so dry and the coating was overcooked & wasn't staying on the chicken. I will stick to my own tried & true oven baked chicken.
I used boneless chicken breasts so I increased the cooking time by 10 minutes and substituted butter for oil.
This was amazingly good. Following another reviewers suggestions I melted half a stick of butter in the pan as the oven heated up. The chicken was crispy and delicious.
We made this recipe with boneless chicken thighs. It was delicious. I will make fried chicken this way every time in the future.

Good recipe. I have tried frying chicken a couple of times before, but was never successful. So, I was happy to give this a try and it turned out well! To the flour I added: seasoned salt, garlic powder, black and red pepper, and Italian seasoning. I cooked the chicken on 365 degrees for 45 minutes (turning the chicken about halfway through). This temperature and timing got the chicken nice a crisp. I will definitely make this again. I can finally fry chicken!! Woo hoo!

I prefer this method because there is no mess! who am I kidding, everyone makes a mess in the kitchen but LESS of a mess. Also I recommend using butter like other reviews mentioned, it makes all the difference and double it!! melt that butter in the pan inside the oven while it's preheating. so awesome. love this recipe
It was moist but the chicken part had no flavor and I added a lot of seasoning more than the recipe called for.
I thought it was unbelievably easy and very good!

I made a full on birthday dinner, ribs, chicken - a ton of food. What was his favorite - the chicken - and I made it with boneless, skinless thighs. I will never have to do fried chicken in oil ever again - hallelujah!!! I did follow some tips, did it on a sheet pan as I had several and didn't want to crowd them, sprayed the pan with pam (forgot about the butter trick, will try that next time) did spray the chicken with some olive oil spray after I flipped it for the top to brown a little more. Nice crunchy coating. Mixed some italian crumbs and panco together and double dipped one side since I had extra egg/crumb mix to be used....great!
Making it for the second time, I do season my chicken with Cajuns seasoning before coating with flour.
I think is was easy and delicious.
We cooked 8 bone-in good sized chicken thighs...1 cup of flour is too much, 3 eggs was perfect, 1 cup of bread crumbs was not enough, pour as you go. Nice easy fried chicken ! Thank You !
This was easy and delicious. The coating kept the chicken moist but wasn‚Äôt too thick. It‚Äôs now my go to for chicken
Good recipe, easy to make and not very messy. Important to remember to salt the chicken on both sides after you remove it from cooking as it cools some.

Oh my! This turned out soooo good! We love fried chicken, but for healthier eating...this was so good and we didn‚Äôt feel as though we compromised much at all. I followed the directions, which are simple, and with this recipe you are able to add your own spices. Definitely a great alternative.

Easy recipe. relatively crispy and very juicy inside. Cooked for the exact time and temperature. I did let the coating sit on the chicken for about 20 mins as suggested by others and coating stayed on well. I wonder if leaving it sit made it less crispy though. I know that happens with shake and bake. Overall, great recipe. Great way to get your fried chicken fix without all the grease.

I‚Äôll never fry chicken again! This baked recipe was scrumptious and so easy. The only change I made was brining and I used a whole cut up chicken. Oh wait, I also used half butter and half oil in the baking dish. It was just delicious!!!
It was good but I probably won't use this recipe again.
I followed the recipe and this was awesome . The chicken was so tender. The husband loved it, it's a keeper.
it was excellent fried chicken without deep frying

I'll go along with pretty much everybody else. This is really, really good. Probably the best fried chicken I ever made. I gave up long ago trying to fry chicken in a pan. Overcooked, undercooked, breading sticks or falls off. Never again. This is simple with fantastic results. I followed directions to the letter. Didn't come out too greasy at all. This will now be go to for fried chicken.

This was a very easy and simple recipe to follow. Only different thing I did was mix Italian bread crumbs with chicken shake n bake. So I had extra breading with flavor! Also next time I probably wont use an entire half cup of oil. Made it greasy. And I wanted baked to avoid just that.

Oh my, this was good. I love fried chicken but like everyone else, not the mess. I refuse to deep fry. Following others' tips, I did not use oil and used both parts of the broiler pan, the grill, and the pan. I did spray the grill. All else as the recipe called for. I did turn on the broiler at the end for 5 min to darken the chicken. Next time I will add some cajun seasoning to kick it up a notch! Yum!

This recipe made me want to cry. It produced the prettiest oven fried chicken I have ever made. The breading stayed on and it was just beautiful. The only changes I made were putting the flour and bread crumb in ziploc bags and I put a piece of parchment on a baking sheet and rubbed olive oil over the sheet instead of using the 1/2 cup as shown. It turned out perfect.
Wonderful Yum! I did a very small version, just me and mom: 2 full chicken breasts and 1 breast fillet.. Reduced all ingredients but.. still had to bake it for 30/30 on each side
Delicious and easy without the fuss of frying!
Even with added spice, super bland. Did brown up OK

It was easy and tasted great! We just had to add more eggs and bread crumbs than the recipe called for, and we cooked it an extra 22 minutes longer than the recipe said, and it was still tender, juicy and cooked through
Turned out crispy and juicy. Great recipe.
I‚Äôll just go back to my fryer. It only takes 18 minutes; not an hour.
It was good but I would cut back a little on the oil.
All I can say is try this recipe! It is easy and very good!
The chicken came out so good . I did use the Olive Oil and use more spices to give it a little more pop and kick. But followed the rest of the directions . So Good.

Excellent recipe - crispy, incredibly tender chicken legs. Didn't use paprika. Used 1/2 cup regular bread crumbs and 1/2 cup panko with italian seasoning, garlic, salt, pepper. Reduced oil to just enough to cover the bottom of the pans.
used skinless chicken breasts, sliced in half. moist, light and delicious. does take a long time but the wait is worth it ;)
Pretty boring. Not bad if you choose to spice it up a bit. I think it was better using cooking spray rather than so much oil.
It was a hit to my guests!! Will definitely make it again & again!!

I actually put 1/2 italian style bread crumbs and the other half regular bread crumbs and omitted the salt...I am very sensitive to sodium and it also put 1/3 - 1/2 of oil, and it came out really good!
My first successful dish! felt like a hero. it was super simple.
This recipe was easy and came out excellent. I added more spices to the flour. It came out very tasty.
Just as messy as traditional fried Chicken. However, this recipe works well and, depending on type and flavor of bread crumbs used produces a flavorful delight to be enjoyed by all.
Loved it...I added a pinch of garlic and onion powder..
Turn out very well . Two changes, soaked the chicken in the egg batter for a few hours then did the flour and breadcrumbs. Also went with the butter instead of oil and for us it was a plus.
I love this simple recipe. I used pablo for the outer bread crumbs.

I really liked the flavor and the method for this recipe. Since other reviewers commented about it being too greasy, I greased my baking dish with a tablespoon of butter then lightly sprayed the tops of my chicken with Pam. I made with skinless chicken breast, then used the leftovers for salads the rest of the week. It‚Äôs a keeper.
This recipe is so good. Easy to make and really tasty. All Recipes is the best!

I used this recipe as a starter recipe. For my chicken I used legs cause that is what I had. In the flour I added a package of dry ranch mix, and in the bread crumbs I added crushed french fried onions. It turned out so juice and delicious!
My oven took longer but it was good. With a 95 year old Dad I'm still afraid of spices.

I did chicken wings instead of thighs and used different seasoning (garlic powder, onion & herb, seasoning salt & pepper). Followed the recipe otherwise. Everything turned out great! Loved how crispy the chicken was without all of the grease. Will definitely do this again!

I really enjoyed this dish. I tried frying it with Pam and it didn't fry as much as I had hoped so I might try it with vegetable oil next time. After the chicken was done on both sides, I put mozzarella cheese on top and it was a wonderful addition. I highly suggest it. Overall, I would make this again. Very easy meal to prep and cook.

This is the best oven fried chicken recipe I've ever tried. It's easy and delicious. It comes out with a nice, crispy coating outside and juicy chicken inside, and without the mess of fried chicken. Two of the tips in the comments/reviews that I use and find very helpful are to refrigerate the coated chicken for at least an hour before baking it and to put it in melted butter instead of oil in the pan. I use two pans so as to not crowd the pieces.
I made it, I just put a little garlic salt on it. My husband loved it!

Delicious and easy to make. I made mine gluten-free using unseasoned bread crumbs in which I added Italian seasoning, and almond flour adding salt and pepper. Otherwise the recipe was the same and even my kid likes it. Will definitely make it again.

This was amazing!! Tastes like deep fried chicken without all the oil and mess and leftover smell ! Less fat eaten as well. Dare I say its like.....even better than a certain colonel's fried chicken from Kentucky! I served mine with green beans and quinoa.

I made the recipe exactly as written. My husband enjoyed having a different flavor profile, while I prefer more traditional seasoning. I will make oven fried chicken again using this technique but without the Italian accents.

I loved this recipe and just made it today. I find this to be a healthier and cleaner version of fried chicken. When I made this I seasoned my chicken to my liking then I followed the instructions. I would also recommend you seasoning the bread crumbs or sprinkling more than just paprika on the top. I sprinkled season salt on top of mine and I loved it.
Did use 1/4 c butter. Will save t
I made this exactly as written and the flavor was good but the texture was mushy and when I flipped the chicken halfway through cooking half of the breading fell off.
Oh my this is just awesome. I made it last week and my husband loved it. It is so much easier than doing it on the stovetop. I have it in the oven right now. A new favorite.
It was really good. Definitely make again
It was very good and crispy.
just didn't care for it.

Very easy recipe for oven fried chicken and it was delicious! I used chicken drumsticks and the chicken was very moist. I think I will what others have done next time by spraying the pan rather than use the oil. I will definitely make it again!

I made this using more Italian bread crumbs than flour. I initially sprayed the pan as others said and then at the 30 min mark added olive oil to the pan. I served this over pasta with marinara sauce and sprinkled parmesan cheese over it. My husband who claimed to not be hungry kept asking for bites of mine lol Will make again!

Delicious!!
My guess loved the flavors!!
Sprayed baking sheet with coconut spray and added hot sauce to whisked egg, everything else was to the recipe, delicious.

Great gluten free, too. First I seasoned the chicken with 1\4 teaspoon garlic, 1\2 teaspoon salt, 1\2 teaspoon black pepper and 1\4 teaspoon paprika. Then I used Bob's mills gluten free flour blend and I added a 1\4 teaspoon paprika, 1\4 teaspoon garlic, and 1\4 teaspoon of salt. Then, I used gluten free breadcrumbs. I seasoned the breadcrumbs with McCormick 's Italian seasoning, 1 1\2 tablespoons and I added a 1\4 teaspoon garlic powder to the breadcrumbs. I followed other suggestions and put a few pats of smart balance butter in a pan lined with parchment paper. I cooked mine for longer, 1.5 hours, but everything was crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. Also flavorful because the seasoning was on the chicken and the coating. Great recipe??!
I made it but tweeked it the way Mom2FourBoys did and it was super delicious!

I followed the recipe and found that there is much work or mess, as frying chicken the conventional way and it doesn't come close to it. 

The only difference is dealing with the frying oil when frying chicken.

If you're looking for easier, this recipe isn't it.
the chicken was very plain tasting the crust came off some of if and my family just didn't like it
